messageBody:
> -----Original Message-----
> From: J. B. Rainsberger [mailto:jbrains@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, January 26, 2005 2:55 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [junit] Re: JDK 1.5 annotations a la nUnit
>
> ezra_epstein wrote:
>
> > But the real reason is de-coupling. ... You simply annotate the
> > class ... you don't need to break out your tests into separate
classes...
>
> I'm biased, being a JUnit user, but I don't like the idea of tests
> living in with the class under test. My objection is that it
> implicitly encourages a testing style with which I disagree:
> that there is a 1:1 correspondence between fixtures and classes under
test.

Yes, discipline and merciless refactoring would be indicated. Also,I think
neat things can be done with custom attrubutes (maybe giving us a much
better approach to aop). I hope sun doesn't mess up that jsr.

thanks
